intro: Bobua koshunensis, commonly known as the Koshun mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine pubescence, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
